text: the Internet has created a monster and
that monster is the digital subscription
after all since Netflix works so well
for movies and Spotify works so well for
music why not apply the same model to
books I tried out three e-book
subscription services to see if any of
them are worth paying nine to ten bucks
a month for here's how they work you
sign up and pay a monthly fee and then
you download the app onto your phone or
tablet or in most cases you can read on
the web there's no limit to how many
books you can have at the same time and
the books will stay there as long as
your subscription is active now in some
ways that sounds like a great deal
because many ebooks already cost more
than 10 dollars so if you read just one
book a month you could come out ahead
and if you're binging on a summer
vacation and you read two or three it's
a screaming deal the newest option is
Kindle unlimited which comes from Amazon
it's the only choice that works on the
ePaper Kindle so if you prefer this to
reading on an LCD screen like I do it's
the best choice although Amazon has a
complicated relationship with publishers
for example you may have heard how it's
feuding with hash yet and in fact none
of the big five publishers are on board
with the service next up there's Easter
which is the prettiest choice it has
some big-name publishers on board like
HarperCollins but also quite a lot of
questionable material I ran across some
hardcore porn titles when I performed
there pretty innocent search so beware
finally they're Scribd which is the
cheapest choice it has the smallest
number of books in its catalogue but it
still has publishers that Amazon does
not these services all have large
numbers and books in their catalogue but
let's just say it's not the new and
noteworthy collection I couldn't find
the Pulitzer Prize winning title
Goldfinch for example or hard choices by
Hillary Clinton and when I asked my
Facebook friends what they were reading
the only title I could find was a 50
year old Kurt Vonnegut book that's not
to say you won't find anything you want
to read you're just not gonna be keeping
up with your book club and who else but
a book club junkie is gonna pay 10 bucks
a month for a digital book subscription
and it's not quite the deal that it
seems to be at first most older ebooks
are already cheaper than $10 and some
are even free I'm just not sure that
everything needs to
a subscription service especially not if
it's more money for fewer options so
here's a tip for you if you have a
Kindle or a Kindle Fire and you
subscribe to Amazon Prime you already
get one free book a month from Amazon's
lending library and right now that
catalog is not that much smaller than
Kindle unlimited so just get Prime and
then you'll also get music movie and TV
streaming plus free shipping now that is
a subscription I can get behind
oh oh
